ExceptionInInitializerError(java.lang.Th.Description: Constructs a new ExceptionInInitializerError class by saving a reference to the Throwable object thrown for later retrieval by the @B_java#lang#ExceptionInInitializerError#getException_E@ method. The detail message string is set to null.

ExceptionInInitializerError(java.lang.St.Description: Constructs an ExceptionInInitializerError with the specified detail message string. A detail message is a String that describes this particular exception. The detail message string is saved for later retrieval by the @B_java#lang#Throwable#getMessage_E@ method. There is no saved throwable object.

Returns: the saved throwable object of this ExceptionInInitializerError, or null if this ExceptionInInitializerError has no saved throwable object.
getException().Description: Returns the exception that occurred during a static initialization that caused this error to be created. This method predates the general-purpose exception chaining facility. The @B_java#lang#Throwable#getCause_E@ method is now the preferred means of obtaining this information.

ExceptionInInitializerError().Description: Constructs an ExceptionInInitializerError with null as its detail message string and with no saved throwable object. A detail message is a String that describes this particular exception.

Returns: the cause of this error or null if the cause is nonexistent or unknown.
getCause().Description: Returns the cause of this error (the exception that occurred during a static initialization that caused this error to be created).

ClassDesc: Signals that an unexpected exception has occurred in a static initializer. An ExceptionInInitializerError is thrown to indicate that an exception occurred during evaluation of a static initializer or the initializer for a static variable. As of release 1.4, this exception has been retrofitted to conform to the general purpose exception-chaining mechanism. The "saved throwable object" that may be provided at construction time and accessed via the @B_java#lang#ExceptionInInitializerError#getException_E@ method is now known as the @B_java#lang#Throwable#getCause_E@ method, as well as the aforementioned "legacy method."
